{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27539].
  {panel}

JQL needs something like:

now()=='Friday'

Use case:
As an Agile/Scrum/GreenHopper user we have an Agile project dashboard including a query for what we completed yesterday and what's assigned to us now.

This quick view is used extensively in the daily stand-up meetings where we normally present yesterdays work and current work.

This view fails us on Monday, as past day doesn't include friday or the occasional weekend work.

We can't use two queries because the dashboard views don't support such a thing.

We need a way for this query to work differently depending on the current day/time so that it can effectively be used in dashboard views.

Having a startOfDay(-1, 'BusinessDaysOnly') feature would be another solution to the problem.
fields.summary: JQL queries that vary by day of the week

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27532].
  {panel}

Setup
=====

We had one custom field named Progress of type Unlimited Text. It was restricted to one project and one issue type. 

Then we added another field named Progress of type Unlimited Text and only restricted it to the issue type, so making it used by all projects.

We then deleted the second field, so now there was only the one original field named Progress.

We did not reindex at any time, at least not using the Admin, Index screen.

Problem
=======

A JQL query with

"project = MYPROJ and issuetype = MyIssueType and Progress is not empty"

that worked before the changes now produced the error:

"Field 'Progress' is not searchable, it is only sortable."

However the following JQL query worked without errors:

"project = MYPROJ and issuetype = MyIssueType and cf[10200] is not empty"

10200 is the id of the original Progress field.

Which suggests to me that something stale can appear in the place where JQL looks up the custom field based on the name of the field.
fields.summary: Removing a custom field with duplicate name breaks JQL search, perhaps a stale cache?

Hi,

Since upgrading to 4.4 Labels in differnt charts are unreadable. I will attach an example Screenshot. 

The visual difference with the labeling is that before, labels on the X-Axis were not tilted 45 degrees. But the point is that now labels appear as a big heap of pixels disturbing the complete layout of the graphics and making it too confusing to use it in reports (which we need to do very often). And we're not able to get rid of this. There is no gadget configuration to "do not tilt x-axis labels" and none to "turn axis labels off".

Regards,

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27503].
  {panel}

It would be great to automatically generate "transitive" release notes - i.e. release notes including other release notes by aggregation.

Use cases:
1) in our appX, we're changing version of depX from 1.9 to 1.10 and we need to "publish" new depX-1.10's features as if they were appX's
2) in the upcoming version of our appX, we're reintegrating code from different projects (prjX, prjZ, etc.), and we need to merge their release notes
3) in bugfix release 3.0.4 we're only porting fixes of the older 2.2.9, so 3.0.4 is basically a one-issue-fixVersion with an almost-empty release note instead of the real, informative, one

In all cases we have:
- a transitive release note that we'd like to include/merge in the final one
- one or more issues (Tasks) representing the activity of updating/reintegrating/porting; these issues usually identify cleary and precisely the unique Project+FixVersion being somehow "included"
- the actual release note being non-informative

Would it be possible, while generating the release note, to replace these special/transitive issue with the referenced releaseNote?
fields.summary: Transitive Release Notes
The issue description should hava a maximum length.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27498].
  {panel}

In the sysadmin team, we're having discussions about ways we can use JIRA to track our regular work better.

Currently, a lot of our work is triggered by emails that spam the entire team - for instance, Nagios alerts and updates to Noctane issues from Contegix both go to the entire team.

This isn't a scalable way of tracking work; everybody assumes that someone else will respond to email; even if someone does respond, there's often no way for the rest of the team to know if someone has already looked at an email or not (we can usually tell if someone has decided to respond, but if someone has looked and decided no response is required, we can't tell that).

Remote Links would be very useful (I think) in helping us to adapt JIRA to better track our work. Every Nagios alert has a url; every Noctane issue has a URL. If we had a bot that could create a JIRA issue and link it back to the remote url, this would be a start. However, we want to make sure that updates to the noctane issue/nagios alert get added to the same issue.

The cleanest way I can think of managing this would be if we can use JQL to search for "issues that link to this remote url"; but that's not currently possible.

The second-cleanest way I can think of managing this is to put the url (or some unique subset of it, like the Noctane issue number) in a custom field. However, the requirement that this field would have to be displayed on the issue type's issue-create screen means that this custom field would get flashed in front of humans all the time. My experience with doing this is that users get confused by this and start asking "Why do I have to fill in this field?", so I'd prefer to avoid having to do that if at all possible.
fields.summary: JQL search for issues that link to a remote URL

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Administrators in a Jira cloud site does not have a way to configure to whom the Contact Administrators Form will be sent. 

# Try to turn on "Contact Administrators Form" through System > General configuration > Contact Administrators Form. 
# If you don't have Jira Administrators global permission you will not receive the email when a user fill in the form. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be helpful to be able to:
1. Choose a separate list of recipients for the Contact Admin form as this will not always match the list of people with *Jira Administrators global permission*. 
2. Have this appear as an option in "Administration -> General Configuration -> Edit Configuration" near where you turn the form 'On'. 

h3. Why this is important
* Customize better Jira and arrange better the work among the administrators. 
* Chances that no-one will then action the request are high with the current default behavior. 
 
h3. Workaround 
* Currently, there is no workaround.
fields.summary: Contact Administrators Form should allow configuration of recipients

  {panel}

One useful feature would be to display more information next to conditions, validators and post-functions to indicate from inside the workflow which plugin provides this feature.

This would help Atlassian Support debug problems that refer to:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Cannot+Create+Issues+due+to+%27Could+not+load+validator%27+class+Errors

It would also help JIRA administrators work out which plugin is providing a workflow extension that is causing problems. The current process involves taking the text displayed for a condition etc and then searching source code of every likely looking installed plugin. That's very inefficient.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27449].
  {panel}

When using an external user directory for password or user management such as Active Directory, it would be good if we could associate a single user with multiple user directories.

Reason: because in most environments there are multiple directory servers for redundancy.  In some places the servers are not as stable as others so one might go down.  

If we could group them together in Jira so that if it sees the same account(user/group) in both directories in the same directory group it recognizes them as the same account.  This would allow external user/password management to continue uninterrupted if one of the directories is not longer accessible.

In our particular case, we are unable to take advantage of the external user/password management features because several times a week at least one of our Domain Controllers goes down - I don't manage them:(.  Jira doesn't recognize one account as being the same in different directories.

So I would like to see the ability to create User Directory groups.  Accounts with the same name in each directory within the same directory group will be viewed by Jira as the same user account or user group.

Does this sound Feasible?  Most companies do not put Active Directory behind a load balancer so this feature would be helpful.

Thanks
fields.summary: Associate a single user account with multiple User Directories

----
(!) When running the following keytool command you will be prompted with:
{noformat}
What is your first and last name?
{noformat}

Instead of entering your first and last name as specified, you must enter the fully qualified hostname of the server running JIRA.

The "Instead of entering your first and last name as specified, you must enter the fully qualified hostname of the server running JIRA" should be bold or use note icon (i)

For example, should look like:
*Instead of entering your first and last name as specified, you must enter the fully qualified hostname of the server running JIRA* 

or 

(i) Instead of entering your first and last name as specified, you must enter the fully qualified hostname of the server running JIRA

Originally raised in https://support.atlassian.com/

{quote}The system should at least generate a warning in the integrity control check and/or during administration of (Issues/Fields/Custom fields) 
and (Issues/Screens/Issue Type Screen Scheme) if :

the custom field is attached to the "available context issue type" and located in the "specific screen" (Issues/Fields/Custom fields)
or the custom field id attached to the "specific screen" (Issues/Screens/Configure)
and ANOTHER Issue Type configured in Issue Type Screen Scheme for the "specific scree"n is not containing the expected custom fields from the "available context issue type" (Issues/Screens/Issue Type Screen Scheme)
As a result, some fields are not rendered in the "specific screen" because no data exists in the project context.

Administrator should also have access to contextual information during Issue browsing to know the current screen / screen scheme ... / fields ...
/ workflow ... / active rules decision plan to easily identify where the configuration issue is located.{quote}

  {panel}

Currently an older version of the Wallboard plugin is bundled.

Plugin key: com.atlassian.jirabuildmonitor.build-monitor
Developer: Atlassian
Plugin version: 1.2.2

When a customer installs the newer version of the Wallboard, JIRA allows both to run at the same time since the newer version has a different plugin key.

Plugin key: com.atlassian.jirawallboard.atlassian-wallboard-plugin
Developer: Atlassian
Plugin version: 1.7.1


Consider replacing the old bundled Wallboard plugin with the newer JIRA 5.0 compatible version.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27397].
  {panel}

There is some leakage of temporary attachments (that have already been uploaded but not yet included in an issue) from one browser tab to another.

Steps to reproduce:
* open two tabs
* in both tabs click the "Create Issue" button
* in tab 1: click "choose file" and add an attachment
* in tab 2: click the "configure fields" and switch the mode from all to custom, or vice-versa. the attachment that was uploaded in tab 1 now shows up in tab 2 (!)

We can easily end up in a situation where we upload attachments to the wrong issue, which is pretty bad (think security levels, permissions, etc). I suspect editing issues will suffer from the same problem.
fields.summary: Temporary attachments leak into other "Create issue" dialogs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27382].
  {panel}

1. Start adding a comment on an issue.
2. Decide that you actually want to perform a workflow change, and use the comment that you've just typed as part of workflow change.
3. Copy the text from the comment box, click Workflow -> More Work Required (custom state in my project). The workflow change has two fields, assignee and comment. I change the assignee and paste my text as the comment, then click Done/Ok
4. A popup will appear asking if I'm sure I want to leave the page and my work will be lost, This confused me so I clicked "Stay on page".

It popups up because I've still got text left in the comment box on the issue page. The popup was very confusing initially.

It's not clear how this should be resolved. One option is that when you click Workflow -> Foo, and you have a comment half typed, you should be forced to discard it before continuing with the workflow change.
fields.summary: Leave page warning after entering comment text on issue, then using workflow popup.
Update URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27379].
  {panel}

The user picker field is, well, ugly. It's just a plain text field.

The user picker field could looks so much better. The text field should allow users to type a name, and the auto-complete can work just as it does now (very good).

But when a user is selected let's move them into a bar below the text field. Something more like what stackoverflow.com does for tags, for example. Or create a bullet point style list of users below the text field where you enter the user names. 

Each user should have an 'x' next to their name to remove them easily (the free-form editing is so ugly).

For example, when a default set of users is selected the field should look like this on a create/edit issue form:

[ Enter user name ]
x Joe Smith
x Allen Brown
x Bob Cline

Here's what it currently looks like:
[ Joe Smith, Allen Brown, Bob Cline ]

It's not at all obvious where to start typing in the 2nd example shown (the current status quo). This could just look so much cleaner.

Also, currently when you set a list of default users, here's how the field looks in a create/edit form:

[com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizUser@1a24c1ae, com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizUser@2f3850, com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizUser@19229, com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizUser@30f400, com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizUser@35f4b0]

ewwwww, ee-gads! This field needs some attention!

A bonus improvement here: Include the ability to work with groups, not just users.
fields.summary: Improve the user picker field to include a list of users selected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27365].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduced the behavior:
- Create a filter spanning 2 projects
!scshot1.png!
- Add the filter to Issue Statistics gadget on the dashboard
- Login using a user that has permissions in only one of the 2 projects
- The filter should be displaying the correct number of issues:
!scshot2.png!
- Upon opening the filter through the gadget, no results will be returned:
!scshot3.png!

Supposedly, the expected result are to see 3 issues listed, whereby the issues belongs to the project that the user has access to.
fields.summary: Shared Filter is not displaying correct number of issues if being opened from Issue Statistics gadget due to project permission configuration
